forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 59. South southwest wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 78, with temperatures falling to around 73 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the dawn settles softly over Downtown San Francisco, the night gives way to a pleasantly mild morning characterized by a lingering cloud cover, gently cloaking the city beneath a shroud of ambiguity. The overnight chill lingers in the air, hanging near 59 degrees, just enough to coax you into a light jacket. Calm winds whisper through the streets, their gentle demeanor hinting at the slowly unfolding beauty of the day ahead.

With the sun poised to break through the clouds, a radiant warmth will emerge as the day ascends, promising a high near 78. But as afternoon approaches, temperatures will beautifully mellow, settling down to a cozy 73. Expect the fog to recede, revealing not only the iconic silhouettes of the Golden Gate Bridge but also the intricate dance of city life awakening beneath a dome of blue. While glimpses of clarity emerge, the marine layer from the bay can still cling to the edges, offering a delightful contrast against the sunny backdrop. Dressing in layers will be wise today—start off with a sweater, which you can shed as midday brings a gentle embrace of warmth, leaving you prepared for an evening stroll or perhaps a quiet moment in one of the many parks that dot this vibrant metropolis. With such delightful conditions, consider wandering the local cafés for a book, or meandering along the waterfront, watching sailboats dance in the breeze, making it an exquisite day to simply savor the here and now.
